data.chText: 好客的；热情友好的；殷勤的
data.enText: pleased to welcome guests; generous and friendly to visitors

data.chText: 当地人对外来客人十分友好热情。
data.enText: The local people are very hospitable to strangers.

data.chText: （作物生长条件）适宜的；（环境）舒适的
data.enText: having good conditions that allow things to grow; having a pleasant environment

simple_means.memory_skill: hospit 客人 + able …的 → 好客的

example: soil sufficiently hospitable for forest growth

tr: disposed to treat guests and strangers with cordiality and generosity

value.def: A hospitable person is friendly, generous, and welcoming to guests or people they have just met.

example.ex: The locals are hospitable and welcoming...
He was very hospitable to me when I came to New York.
example.tran: 我来到纽约时，他对我很热情周到。

value.tran: 好客的;殷勤周到的;热情友好的

value.def: A hospitable climate or environment is one that encourages the existence or development of particular people or things.

example.ex: Even in summer this place did not look exactly hospitable.
example.tran: 即使在夏天，这个地方看起来也不太舒适宜人。

partsOfSpeech.dec: hospit 客人 + able …的 → 好客的
hospit 客人 + al 表名词 → 把病人当客人的地方 → 医院

partsOfSpeech.d: 主人（原意指招待客人的人）

partsOfSpeech.dec: host 客人 + age 表行为 → 把客人〔留住〕→ 人质
host 客人 + el 表地点 → 客人住的地方 → 旅馆
host 客人 + ess 表女性 → 女主人
